skill.name: context-persistence
skill.description: Waypoint plans methodology and session survival patterns for Claude Code. Use when working on long-running features, need to resume after context reset, want to document task progress, or need to survive session interruptions. Covers three-file structure (plan/context/tasks), SESSION PROGRESS tracking, quick resume instructions, update frequency, and context handoff patterns.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. The skill teaches a methodology for context persistence through documentation patterns.

content.user_title: Preserve context after Claude Code resets
content.value_statement: Context resets in Claude Code cause lost progress and repeated explanations. This skill provides a three-file waypoint pattern (plan/context/tasks) that documents decisions, tracks progress, and enables resume in under 60 seconds after interruptions.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured three-file waypoint documentation for task tracking
Implements SESSION PROGRESS pattern for quick resume after context resets
Documents decisions with rationale for future reference
Provides slash commands for plan creation, context updates, and resumption
Tracks completion status across multi-session projects
Archives completed work for clean project organization
limitations: Requires manual updates to maintain accuracy
Does not auto-detect code changes in the working directory
Cannot prevent context resets from occurring
Only applies to Claude Code, not other AI platforms

use_cases.title: Multi-day feature development
use_cases.description: Document complex features that span multiple work sessions and resume quickly after context resets or overnight breaks.

use_cases.title: Team handoff documentation
use_cases.description: Create clear task status documentation that enables smooth handoffs between team members or sessions.

use_cases.title: Long-running research projects
use_cases.description: Maintain context across extended research sessions without losing discoveries, decisions, or progress.

prompt_templates.title: Create a new waypoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a waypoint plan for implementing user authentication with JWT tokens

prompt_templates.title: Update progress
prompt_templates.prompt: I completed the login page and am now working on the token refresh logic in auth.ts. Update the context.

prompt_templates.title: Resume interrupted work
prompt_templates.prompt: Resume work on the authentication implementation. What was the last progress?

prompt_templates.title: Archive completed task
prompt_templates.prompt: The authentication feature is complete. Archive the waypoint plan.

output_examples.input: Resume work on the authentication implementation
output: ‚úÖ COMPLETED (4/8): Supabase Auth configured, created auth utilities, built login page, built signup page
üü° IN PROGRESS (1/8): Implementing token refresh logic
üéØ NEXT ACTION: Handle token expiration gracefully in lib/supabase/auth.ts

best_practices: Update SESSION PROGRESS after each significant milestone, not after every line of code
Be specific in NEXT ACTION with exact file paths and function names for immediate resume
Include timestamps and document decisions with their rationale for future reference
anti_patterns: Leaving context stale for more than 3 days without updates
Using vague descriptions like 'working on auth' instead of specific tasks
Skipping the NEXT ACTION section which is critical for quick resume

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill is designed specifically for Claude Code and its slash command system. It may not work in other AI assistants.

faq.question: How long does it take to resume work after a context reset?
faq.answer: With properly maintained waypoint files, resume typically takes under 60 seconds by reading the context and tasks files.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: It works with the Claude Code Waypoint Plugin commands (/create-plan, /update-context, /resume) but does not directly integrate with external tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only creates and reads markdown files in your plans directory. No data is sent externally or shared with third parties.

faq.question: Why is my context showing as stale?
faq.answer: Context becomes stale after 3 days without updates, when code changes significantly, or when blockers are noted but not resolved. Refresh by verifying current state and updating.

faq.question: How is this different from simple note-taking?
faq.answer: The waypoint pattern enforces a structured three-file approach (plan/context/tasks) with specific sections like SESSION PROGRESS that enable automated resume functionality.
